profileDetails.fullText:
ï»¿Bahanur at a glance
Who am I?
I'm a 34-year-old Turkish woman currently based in Malaysia. I work in education and genuinely love what I do. I'm not interested in side hustles, entrepreneurship, or the grind culture that seems to dominate modern dating profiles. My regular schedule and calendar are grounding, they enable me to follow my passion and just be. I've lived across multiple countries in Europe and Asia, and my job gives me geographic flexibility, so I'm genuinely open to relocating for the right person.  
Important: I don't do magical thinking or use LDR as an excuse to be emotionally avoidant. I'm genuinely looking for a real, committed partnership, and the distance is a practical reality, not a psychological shield. It would be wonderful if you're based in Asia so we could be geographically closer, but I understand that's not always how life works.
My personality
I'm someone who contains multitudes. I can discuss Chris Marker and memory one moment, then crack jokes about the latest South Park episode the next. I have a deep, contemplative side that loves art, literature, philosophy, and meaningful conversation, but I'm also genuinely funny and don't take myself too seriously. I can laugh at my own absurdities and find humor in life's contradictions. I value authenticity over performance, and I'd rather have one real conversation than a dozen superficial ones.
I'm grounded and present in my daily life. I find joy in simple things like watching birds on my rooftop, good coffee at my favorite cafÃ©, dancing alone in my apartment, or meaningful conversations with colleagues. I'm independent and self-sufficient. I don't need someone to complete me or fix my life. I'm looking for a partner to share experiences with, not someone to rescue me or be rescued by me. I'm resilient, empathetic, and kind. I show up for people I care about and I expect the same in return. I believe in fighting for what matters and letting go of what doesn't serve me.  
I'm a community-oriented ambivert wherever I live. I enjoy being an engaged member of my surroundings and doing good in the world. You don't need to be as social as I am, but you should appreciate this quality in me.
I've done extensive therapy and personal growth work to overcome a difficult background, and I'm incredibly attracted to people who've done the same. If you've worked through your own challenges with persistence, therapy, and self-reflection, that's deeply appealing to me.
My daily life & what matters to me
I really care about my daily rhythm and lifestyle. I'm genuinely content with what I have and excited about my life as it is. I love waking up in the morning and I'm grateful for everything I have. I don't need to go to the Bahamas or any other exotic location to have a sense of adventure. For me, adventure can be around the corner in my own neighborhood, and I have plenty of examples to share with people who are interested to listen.
I pay attention to the world around me, and I believe attention is the rarest form of love. I notice the small things, the moments that make life beautiful. This doesn't mean I don't enjoy travel or new experiences, but I don't need constant external stimulation to feel alive.
I exercise regularly and care about eating healthy. I'm interested in exploring vegetarianism, so if you're already vegetarian or also interested in that lifestyle, that would be a wonderful thing to share and explore together.
My interests & hobbies
I love literature, books, words, and images. I've always been drawn to writing, literature, cinema, and languages. They mean a lot to me. I love taking on projects and learning new things on my own. Currently, I'm working through The Artist's Way and taking a course on The American Novel Since 1945. I've been doing the latter for about half a year now, and I genuinely enjoy this kind of self-directed learning.  
I also love music projects. I took on the 1001 Albums You Must Hear Before You Die challenge, and it took me three years to complete. I'll share the link here if you're curious about my musical journey.
Most of my activities require more mental labor than physical labor, though I don't shy away from physical work when needed. I'm drawn to pursuits that engage my mind and creativity (reading, writing, language learning, artistic projects). I'm interested in eventually balancing this with more hands-on activities like gardening or baking, where I can create something tangible and connect with the physical world in a different way. 
You don't have to share all of these interests, but you should understand and respect that reading, learning, and creative work are essential parts of who I am. They're how I process the world, how I grow, and how I find meaning.


What I'm looking for
I'm looking for someone emotionally mature and intelligent who understands what a long-distance relationship actually entails: it requires EXTRA communication and consistency, not less.
My non-negotiables:
* Childfree: no children for me, but open to dating someone who already has kids and co-parents well
* Emotionally intelligent and self-aware: ideally someone who has done therapy/personal growth work
* Consistent and reliable: someone who follows through on what they say
* Strong communicator: can acknowledge vulnerability, discuss feelings, handle conflict maturely without defensiveness or passive-aggression
* Established and stable: financially responsible, has their own life, interests, and/or friend groups
* No substance abuse issues: occasional social drinking is fine, but no dependency
* Gaming/internet use is recreational, not escapism: I'm grounded in real life and need a partner who is too
* Wants genuine partnership: someone who wants to grow beside me, not someone looking for a parent/therapist/project
Additional deal-breakers:
* Strictly monogamous (non-negotiable)
* Political values: I'm a leftist, though my views may be quite different from American leftism. I believe in "live and let live."
* Religion: I'm an atheist, but I don't have any problems having a religious partner as long as they don't push their agenda on me. I'm very accepting of other people as long as they're accepting of me.
Partnership to me means two whole people who choose each other and actively work to maintain connection. We have our own hobbies, friends, and interests, but we want to prioritize each other and our relationship. We communicate openly, handle conflicts maturely, and show up consistently even when it's hard.
What dating me looks like
I genuinely value consistency and accountability. Love bombing or grand gestures do not work for me. What works is showing up in my life consistently, being respectful of my boundaries and rhythm, and understanding that I respect yours too.  
Daily check-ins are very important to me. They help me feel grounded and avoid triggering old attachment wounds from my past. I don't need long texts, just simple things like "I saw this and thought of you" or "how was your day?" that put a smile on my face. Weekly deeper connections like video calls or longer voice messages are also important to maintain intimacy and presence. I understand life gets in the way, but consistent effort matters deeply to me.
My love languages:
* Words of affirmation (primary)
* Quality time (primary)
* Physical touch (primary)
* Acts of service and gift giving are my "foreign" love languages. I'm still learning to receive and appreciate them.
When I date someone, I don't want to do the heavy lifting. I want it to feel reciprocal, easy, and fun. Feeling at ease with someone and letting things naturally flow is the most important thing for me. I like a slow-burn approach, and since I don't plan to have children, I feel I have all the time in the world for a potential partner and me to see if we really vibe together. I see this as an opportunity to build something real.  
I don't use dating apps. I don't believe in swiping through people like commodities. I prefer slow-burn connections built on genuine compatibility and shared values. I like to move to voice messages or video calls relatively early (not immediately, but once we've established basic compatibility through text) to see if there's natural chemistry and get a feel for each other's energy.
I appreciate people holistically (intellectually, emotionally, physically), and I want someone who sees and values all aspects of who I am, not just one dimension.
Important notes
* I'm serious about my boundaries and standards. I've learned what I don't want from experience, and I'm not willing to compromise on my core needs.
* If you're interested in reaching out, please write something thoughtful that shows you actually read this document. One-sentence messages will not get replies.
How to reach me
If this resonates with you, please email me at: laflaneuse91@gmail.com. In your email, tell me a bit about yourself, what caught your attention in this document, and what you're looking for in a partner. 
  P.S.
Thank you for taking the time to read this far. I know it's a lot, but if you've made it to the end, it means you're someone who values depth and intentionality, which I really appreciate.
Even if you're not personally interested but know someone who might be a great match for me, feel free to play traditional matchmaker! If you introduce me to someone and we end up being compatible, I'd love to send you a thank-you gift for bringing us together. :)

I am 20 years old, 5'9" or 174 cm looking for a monogamous relationship. I am currently living in Cincinnati, Ohio, but plan on moving to SF/NYC soon.

Who I am:

Secure attachment style
Primary love languages: Physical Touch, Quality Time, Words of Affirmation.
I can give most love languages liberally. Acts of Service and Gift giving does not come naturally, and will take time to experiment and learn.
Feedback from my last long term relationship:
* Can be rude when stressed or when focused and interrupted (working on this)
* Can hurt without intending to 
I want to have kids at some point. Most likely when I am wealthy enough for consumer things to be virtually free and when I can homeschool them myself or pay for schools that make sense, e.g. Alpha School. I will be damned if I am going to teach my kid to ask permission to pee.
I do not believe in god. I was muslim and am now atheist. I get the belief but if your beliefs limit your agency, I am unlikely to make you happy. I will happily tell our children why they should not believe though.
I am a man of routine. I want to be in one place while I build wealth. After that may be a nomadic lifestyle due to my love for mountain biking.
Why you should not date me:
* I eat clean food (mostly chicken/rice/veggies), rarely eating out (unless on a trip). If you cook me a mean steak, I will not refuse though.
* I train at the gym 5x a week.
* If you do not want to get on creatine and other longevity routines, because I want to live for a long time. If we get together, I would like to have you live with me as long as possible.
* When we fight you will get no space, at least physically, but most likely mentally too. I am much more likely to hold you while you gather yourself than let you walk off. 
* Largely traditional values, I think. I am new to the American value system so I may be wrong here.
I am looking for a partner, and the mother of my children. In this, I do not expect you to be a housewife or homemaker because that job can be replaced for 40k USD/year. A mother on the other hand, I can say due to my mother, whose upbringing has contributed to outlier outcomes.
I am looking for someone that believes in me even more than I do, and will be loyal. Someone that wants me to be more of me.
I am currently centering my life on getting smart so I can work on difficult and useful problems and create wealth on the way. The goal for me to have come to the US is to live post-scarcity. Before this, I spent some time in New Zealand because I wanted to be a professional mountain biker. There I discovered that I hate poverty more than I love mountain biking.
I live in ways that make sense to me. For example:
* I sleep on the floor
* I am happy to do dinner dates but will carry my lunchbox with me.
* I recently learned it is polite in the US to wait for your friend to start eating. Why would I do that? Why would I want my friend to be hungrier for longer? Makes 0 sense.
I do have an asian toughness or rashness I would say, and I like that untamed part of me. I have been described as, â€œthe youngest old man I knowâ€, â€œraw and realâ€, â€œannoying, real and lovingâ€, all by different people.
I will most likely go all in soon to try to break things once I am aligned, so in case things don't work out we save the most time and in case we do, I can love you for longer.
Currently I am solving a problem that involves hardware and prototyping a solution. The market seems to be relatively small but high income. Solutions seem to be DIYed but no official solutions exist yet.
I would love a TVD kind of love but have learned enough to not expect that. What I am looking for now can be accurately summed up in a cofounder for my life and family, possibly business. It could be summed up as the Hormozis, or Courtney and Cbum. As long as I am better with you, I want to be with you, because I want to be better. This could be on the homefront, on the business front, or you could be an artist and have that dynamic. I am open to most things.
I may want to go back to NZ when raising children but that is quite far away.
Life is short, and we will all die. Text me and Iâ€™ll take you swing dancing after we walk and talk.
Email: ilyaasatwork@gmail.com
Signal (preferred): https://signal.me/#eu/8rAMyrw0tr8VHJ_8HmYPrUh09N7NYxlfSBkue8poD9a-b62q3VxLNoOvYpE6Zpyd

N MY UNDERGRADUATE YEARS, I was very focused on my studies.  So when my parents found out after graduation that I had departed from my studies and become interested in solving the worldâ€™s problems, they were surprised and worried that I wouldnâ€™t be able to find a proper job.  They asked â€œwhy donâ€™t you become a politician?  We can support your further studies.â€  I responded that while it is an option, there is one vocation with a greater potential to do good, and that is the philosopher.  I hope that by perpetually learning, understanding perspectives, and experiencing all that the world has to offer, I can philosophise with enough acuity to help guide humanity through these turbulent times and contribute to our roadmap for the future.    
About me  
* I am a 25-year-old 175cm-tall man.
* I work as an online tutor, an occupation bestowed upon me by my wanderlust.  Even though I currently live in Melbourne, I could be anywhere, anytime.
* I am agnostic and liberal-leaning.  I donâ€™t drink or smoke.  I neither have nor want children.
Core values
I am a positive, lively, and happy person.  Life is inherently beautiful, and the world is my playground.  I think most people who meet me would say I have a fun, bubbly character.  I loathe to offend others, though I feel disingenuous telling white lies, so I have become quite adept at telling â€œwhite truthsâ€.
I am extremely curious.  One of my long-term goals is to â€œclimb the mountain of knowledgeâ€.  This knowledge includes reading undergraduate textbooks on every major university discipline, but equally includes picking up skills and experiences, travelling the natural and cultural world, and so on.  A Chinese proverb tells me â€œread ten thousand books and journey ten thousand milesâ€.  Of course, I realise that life is too short to accomplish this goal, but the process matters more to me than the destination.  Besides, the mountain of knowledge has no summit!
I am independent and free-spirited.  I donâ€™t like relying on others, and rarely ask others for favours.  Despite being a bit of a people-pleaser, I am highly resistant to peer-pressure, and do not mind being perceived as quirky.  In thought, I am naturally skeptical and like to come to my own conclusions.
I have many ideas and perspectives.  I love exploring the intangible world through conversation, whether that leans objective (such as STEM, history, society, politics, ...) or subjective (such as life, relationships, experiences, identity, ...).  If I think an opinion is one-sided, I feel an urge to defend other perspectives, as â€œa wise man proportions his belief to the evidenceâ€.  Because of this, I can play a mighty devilâ€™s advocate, though I realise it is seldom called for.
I am highly greed-avoidant.  I believe that it is possible to live a happy and fulfilling life on a modest amount of money, so I am suspicious of rich people who earn more than they can ever spend.  I would rather do meaningful work voluntarily (and I do) than be paid well to do a bullshit job.  The rich and the poor are both preoccupied with money at the expense of happiness, so I intend to be neither.


â€œTony will no doubt be one of the most interesting people youâ€™ll ever meet. [...] Tony is also incredibly warm and brings a very positive energy to any group activity.â€
      â€” Alan, friend of two years
About you
It is difficult to qualify what one finds attractive.  For me, sharing core values is a good start.  In terms of character, I generally find myself attracted to quieter people who feel deeply, care unabashedly, and whose smile and laughter bring joy to the world.  Having agency and a strong work ethic is also a big plus.  Many of the qualities I am attracted to are shared by affectionate cats, and I confess I absolutely adore cats and it seems they generally like me back!
About us
I believe that the happiest relationships are those where the partners are already happy coming into the relationship.  The most uplifting relationships are those where each partnerâ€™s strengths inspire the other to grow.  The most loving relationships are those built upon a deep friendship and a genuine respect for each other.  
Iâ€™m looking for love that makes life worth living all over again.
It is said that Zeus knew humans would be too powerful if we werenâ€™t split at birth and condemned to search for our other half.  But really, he just meant us.  Weâ€™d be the power couple who saves the world.  Maybe weâ€™ve finally found each other, much to Zeusâ€™ chagrin?  If you think this might be the case, please dispatch a messenger to deliver your message to the following address at once.  We can then conduct a low-stakes holographic encounter through the aether  :)
TW2000X@GMAIL.COM
  More photos of me and my travels

For me, kindness is more about skillful compassion, attunement, warmth, and caring, and less about being nice, or being seen as nice.

â€œOne of the most reasonable people Iâ€™ve ever metâ€ â€“ Matt, former partner and current friend


Through long deliberate practice, Iâ€™m good at:
* Expressing my needs and wants, capacities and boundaries

Iâ€™m strong!
  
  

I care about staying active. A teahouse is a lovely space to catch your breath and recenter yourself with some good convos and warm beverages before heading back out into a big event.

Sharing wonderful experiences
Acroyoga and dance
  

  







I go to acroyoga, and ecstatic dance, almost every week. 
I like contact improv, and Iâ€™d like to explore more of the combo of acroyoga lifts + contact flow. Iâ€™ve also done a little bit of fusion dance.


Music!
* I love to sing! From sacred songs and hippie choirs, to writing my own sea shanty about the crews that repair undersea internet cables
* I play with a Zimbabwean-style marimba ensemble! Itâ€™s a thing all along the west coast! Hereâ€™s the band from the next island over playing some excellently danceable traditional songs, and hereâ€™s a clip of me playing a less conventional marimba song. Sometimes I get to play the BIG bass marimba:

Massage, improv, making cool stuff â€“ so many ways to enjoy being human together!


Nature
* I ALWAYS want to see a cool bug! Or plants, fungi, frogs, other critters, cool rocks, tide pools, shooting stars, the aurora, particularly good cloudsâ€¦
* I went to undergrad and part of a PhD program in ecology. Narrowly escaped becoming a world expert in shrimp that climb up waterfalls in Puerto Rico.
  

Seeing the monarch butterflies overwintering in MichoacÃ¡n  
  

I like the good shapes and patterns
Visual art Iâ€™ve made! 
  



tumblr archive, scroll down to about 2013
  



Being with the sacred
This part is hard to put into words, and itâ€™s important to me. 

Thereâ€™s a phrase from a song that really resonates with me: â€œtil evâ€™ry casual corner blooms into a shrine.â€


I used to have a driving sort of overarching sense of mission, but it turned out that was entangled with a correspondingly big sense of there being an overwhelming problem â€œout there.â€ I used to think I failed at several big attempts to make a difference, but as more stuff has gotten healed and untangled â€œin here,â€ and as Iâ€™m leaning more into exploring Dzogchen Buddhist perspectives, and touching into experiences of deep okaynessâ€¦ it seems my sense of purpose is becoming more contextual and harder to describe.


Hereâ€™s a thread of what happened the last time I said, â€œgee I sure wish I felt inspired to make devotional art again" (and some more recent physical talismans).

For now, I often find myself stewarding profound experiences in liminal spaces, and that feels very meaningful to me. For example, this summer will mark my fourth year leading the Sanctuary team at our regional Burning Man event. We put together a big cozy tent where volunteers support folks who are having unexpectedly difficult psychedelic or emotional experiences. Itâ€™s a good spot for snot and tears and holy laughter. And we have snacks!


In some ways, the path is made by walking, and weâ€™ll find out what itâ€™s like as we go along. I want to be in partnership with someone who wants to walk this path with me. 
Love languages
I especially enjoy giving and receiving physical touch and acts of service. Words are hard sometimes but when they land they really land.


I'm also all about that one tweet on the â€œfive neurodivergent love languages":
"infodumping, parallel play, support swapping, Please Crush My Soul Back Into My Body, and "I found this cool rock/button/leaf/etc and thought you would like it""


I will 100% research a thing for you as a love language. (ex: debug a health situation, find obscure product or service)
Food, drink, substances


What
	Me
	Looking for
	Cigarettes
	Nope! Canâ€™t stand cigarette smoke
	Nonsmoker
	Alcohol
	Rarely / occasionally
	Anywhere from none to mindful use
	Weed
	Rarely / occasionally
	Anywhere from none to mindful use
	Psychedelics
	Very important to me
	Ideally important for you as well
	Meat
	Pescetarian (I eat fish, eggs, dairy)

(I care about where meat comes from - took a workshop on mindful rabbit processing, will eat hunted meat, etc)
	Iâ€™m generally more compatible with omnivores than vegans
	

Iâ€™m pretty good at cooking, and also enjoy making food together. Iâ€™ve won my share of potlucks â€“ I know itâ€™s not a competition, but in my book, if someone asks you for the recipe, thatâ€™s a win!
Weâ€™re likely not a fit if
* You canâ€™t handle a touch of the â€˜tism
   * Benefits: 
      * Strong sense of integrity; natural inclination towards being straightforward and honest
   * Mixed blessings: 
      * Will go to great lengths to craft my environment with the good textures / lightbulbs / noises over the bad ones
      * â€œDonâ€™t worry, I have a System!â€
      * Can be stubborn until I feel satisfied about my care or concern
(and occasionally downright ornery â€“ but thatâ€™s from my Southern roots)
   * Drawbacks: 
   * Sometimes social situations are hard or confusing if the norms are Guess Culture, or if certain kinds of pretending are load-bearing
   * Remembering names & faces requires deliberate effort & practice

      * You 100% need specific intense kinky dynamics in your primary relationship
      * Iâ€™m up for trying some stuff, but if itâ€™s intense power or pain, Iâ€™m most likely not your gal.
      * But if itâ€™s something you can explore in another relationship, in a way thatâ€™s compatible with our whole deal â€“ that could work!


      * Ah, if youâ€™re super allergic to cats Iâ€™d be sad! I donâ€™t have a cat at the moment, but I love cats. A house doesnâ€™t quite feel like a home to me without a cat or two.
More logistics
Location
      * Iâ€™m a Canadian permanent resident & US citizen
      * Originally from the southeast US
      * Iâ€™m enjoying Victoria, BC, and would consider moving to somewhere like west coast USA or southern Appalachia
      * I do take moving a lot more seriously now than I used to, because local social connections take years to develop, and Iâ€™ve been growing some good roots here over the last 4 years.


      * Iâ€™m generally not a big city gal. I tend to like smaller cities, ~100-500K, or living an hour or two from a bigger city, with access to nature. I could go more rural or more urban, with the right crew and context.

      * If youâ€™re not in Canada and want to be, I could sponsor a partner for immigration - though not until 2027 :/ 
Relationships and family
         * I generally prefer the more communicative, kitchen-table style of polyamory. 


         * When I say Iâ€™m looking for someone who â€œwants to raise kids in some larger-than-nuclear-family setting,â€ this could look like sharing space (like a large house, property w/ multiple structures, or neighborhood) with
         * another couple with compatible parenting intentions
         * some combination of lovers or friends
         * your relatives if we all get along well enough


         * Iâ€™d like to aim for having 2 kids, ideally starting in the next few years. I find it a little hard to imagine what 3 kids would be like, but Iâ€™m open to it if logistics & biology line up. 
I went to Mexico this February and froze a good number of eggs, enough for a solid chance at one kid, maybe enough for two. (Ideally I wouldnâ€™t need to use themâ€¦ while Iâ€™d rather not wait that long, my mom had my sibling at 44 and my great-grandmother had my grandmother at 45.)


            * Iâ€™m divorced. We tried really hard. That relationship ended a few years ago, and while it wasnâ€™t easy, Iâ€™ve done a lot of untangling and healing since then. Iâ€™m in a good place to date now, which I couldnâ€™t have said a couple years ago.


            * Iâ€™m potentially open to other shapes of relationships, with folks who arenâ€™t compatible as life partners, though thatâ€™s really not my focus. Mostly if youâ€™re local to BC, or if weâ€™re already connected through some kind of network of friends or shared purpose and weâ€™ll be going to the same event. 
Misc
            * Enneagram 5 is a decent map of some of my patterns growing up, still useful context on how I sometimes get tangled up
            * I speak Spanish (was professionally proficient about 10 years ago, though itâ€™s gotten a bit rusty)
Music
If I was going to share one song as part of this dating doc, itâ€™d be â€œHarmonizeâ€ by Rising Appalachia.


If you want a whole playlist with some different kinds of music I like, hereâ€™s a sampler

Movement and Nourishment 


A little story about me:
I was born in Seoul, Korea and moved to west Los Angeles when I was 9 months old. My father had lived most of his adult life in the US and wanted to get his MBA at USC. I attended Carlthorp School then Marlborough School, and undergrad at Williams College in western Massachusetts to become a contemporary art curator. Along the way I heavily pursued Buddhist psychology living at various Zen temples and Buddhist retreat centers. While learning German in Berlin, I discovered activist art and changed my major to Studio art when I returned to school. I won a travel scholar grant to study activist art in Korea and eventually focused on durational performance art and social practice. After college I lived at an intentional community for contact improvisation called Earthdance Creative Living Project where I studied Body-Mind Centering, Authentic Movement, and a host of other embodied anatomy movement practices. I returned to Los Angeles to study Continuum Movement with Emilie Conrad until she passed away in 2014. I decided to dedicate my career to combining somatics with medicine and completed post baccalaureate pre medical training at UCLA Extension while studying craniosacral therapy. That led me to the National University of Natural Medicine in Portland Oregon where I reside to this day.

About Me
Monelâ€™s Compass Bio
1. Introduction
Hi, Iâ€™m Monel, a 36-year-old Korean-American naturopathic doctor and performance artist living in the Pacific Northwest. I speak Korean, English, and conversational Spanish and German. My days flow between patient care, artistic exploration, and outdoor adventures in the forested trails nearby.
2. Connection Goals
Iâ€™m seeking a life partnerâ€”someone who shares the desire to build a biological family rooted in love, play, and shared growth. Iâ€™m in the PST timezone with a flexible schedule, and I most enjoy connecting through video calls and in-person meetups where energy and presence can be felt more fully.
3. Core Values
Integrity: living in alignment with my words and actions.
Kindness: leading with compassion toward myself and others.
Creativity: approaching life as an ongoing artistic and healing process.
4. Interests & Activities
I find joy in contact improvisation dance, hiking, and backpacking in nature. I love exploring somatics and interoception, and I often unwind by experimenting with new recipes and tasting unfamiliar flavors. Movement, sensory exploration, and curiosity are my gateways into connectionâ€”with myself and others.
5. Personality & Thinking Style
I think emotionally, creatively, and logically, often weaving all three into how I approach life. While I identify loosely as an ENFP, I see personality as fluid and context-dependent. My humor leans toward playful and introspective, and I value conversations that dance between depth and delight.
6. Lifestyle & Preferences
I live a healthy, balanced lifestyleâ€”exercise daily, eat mostly whole foods, and rarely drink or smoke. I currently rent a home with two close friends, and Iâ€™m hoping to own a place next year. I work a hybrid 9-5 resident position at a clinic, blending structure with flexibility.
7. Health & Self-Improvement
Iâ€™ve been dedicated to therapy and self-growth since I was 16, exploring modalities like Internal Family Systems and deep self-inquiry. My current focus is cultivating self-love and integrationâ€”learning to meet each inner part with acceptance and curiosity.
8. Romantic Relationships
Iâ€™m pansexual, though I tend to lean toward the middle of the Kinsey scale (2.5). My love languages are quality time and physical touch, expressed through presence, playfulness, and care. I hope to co-create a partnership that supports mutual evolution, embodied intimacy, and a shared dream of family life.
9. Ideal Connections
I feel most at ease with embodied, grounded people who are self-aware, intuitive, and comfortable in their own skin. Iâ€™m drawn to those who value clear communication, vulnerability, and emotional honestyâ€”people who meet life with both reverence and humor.
10. Altruistic & Community Values
I care deeply about environmental sustainability and holistic healthcare access. I aspire to contribute to communities that prioritize wellbeing, ecological awareness, and equitable systems of care.
11. Conversation Starters
What is your inner dialogue like?
How are you connected to your body?
What creative endeavors help you feel most alive?

based on recent endorsements: 
  

	[Placeholder for sophisticated show-don't-tell pieces of text that display that some of those adjectives apply to me.]

â€œLooks like Tinkerbellâ€
	What tests say about me: 
* BIG 5: Very high â€œOpenness to Experienceâ€ and â€œAgreeablenessâ€, average â€œEmotional Stabilityâ€, â€œExtraversionâ€, and â€œConscientiousnessâ€.
* Outlier scores: Mensa member, hyper-phantasia (vivid mental experiencing), Highly Sensitive Person (HSP: feeling intensely).
* Hogwarts hat announced: 37% Ravenclaw, 29% Gryffindor, 19% Hufflepuff, 15% Slytherin.
What I say about myself:
* Ordinary romantic carbon-based cell-cluster looking for their person
* I am into science, entrepreneurship, psychology, health, AI, Sci-Fi, love, and making music. 
* I have a personality, hobbies, and questions, like lists and statements with percentages.

Some hard facts
Body: tiny, athletic (exercises almost every day), in her thirties, overestimated 38% muscle mass (the rest is mainly cucumber), vegan, and low-carb when convenient.
Orientation: Hetero, monogamous, on the demi- and sapiosexual spectrum, switch, unlikely to want kids (20%, in case my future partner can inspire me with his vision of a family and the shared mission around it).
Location: Currently living in Berlin, but want to move somewhere else. Looking for one or more places to make and call home. Often traveling to explore different cities.
Some soft facts
Good conversationalist. People who have just met me frequently state that they enjoyed conversing with me to an unusual extent, that they feel seen and inspired. Also, partners and friends often acknowledge my constructive and compassionate way I deal with and communicate during conflicts, even in heated situations or when I feel hurt.
Female MacGyver: I can heat the flat by opening the oven, prepare eggs in a water cooker, find and use the holes in systems. My time on this planet has shown again and again that problem-solving to bring something useful and new to life seems to be my superpower.

What I do
My calling. The work I do isn't just a careerâ€”it's an extension of my deepest hope for humanity. Each small victory in creating positive change fills me with a sense of purpose that resonates through everything else in my life. Operating at the intersection of science, mental health, and kindergarten-ing (leadership ;), I founded, built, and manage a Non-Profit Organization. Based on the principles of Effective Altruism, we aim to do good better and to prove if we actually do that. Soon, I'll attempt to build something new. One thing I am proud of is that I have been the youngest professor ever appointed at the university where I used to work.
Making music. I play the keyboard and the organic instrument (voice ^.^), very gladly and very mediocre. Single-player and multiplayer modes are available. Genres: mainly jazz, rock, and soul. Covers, improvising, or songwriting. My favorite quote from myself: "Nothing is so bad that you can't write a good song about it." I might get excited to show you songs I contributed to or wrote at trust level 3.
Learning. Learning new things lights a fire in me that's hard to describeâ€”it's that rush of connecting dots, of seeing the world through a new lens, of feeling my mind expanding.There is a long list of topics I'd like to dive into. Recent topics I've learned more about: ETFs, spine-related and supplement science (medical stuff), and how to build and prompt LLM agents. Also, I am still on the journey to finding a type of dance to do regularly again. The latest ones tested: contact improvisation, Bachata and Swing dance (beginner+), before that, pole dance, and Aerial hoop (not so much a beginner).
  
  

My social life
Communities: I love mingling at national and international weekends/events organized by communities such as Dynamite Circle, Effective Altruism, LessWrong, Mensa, Burning Man.
Sharing. Understanding how the world works and what it looks like for other people, especially those close to me and those I admire, has been one of my favorite hobbies since I was a teenager. Many thoughts during my day are dedicated to this. I love listening to people sharing their latest insights, ideas, or solutions they came up with, e.g., their new start-up pitch, or results from their daily observations or experiments with reality.
Close ones. The friendships I treasure most are the "Frodo & Sam" type, where silence feels as comfortable as conversation, where the connection remains unshaken even through life's storms, and where you know you could call at 4 am, and they'd be there for you as you'd be for them. I feel lucky and thankful to have a few of those humans in my life.
What I am looking for
TL;DR: A vulnerable Chuck Norris with empathy ;-). A loving and deep companionship.
I'm seeking someone whose presence feels like coming home after a long journeyâ€” safe, and exactly where I'm meant to be. Someone whose mind challenges mine and who knows the melody of my heart by heart.
   * Male and single, 26â€“43 years old
   * Caring, cognitively and emotionally empathetic
   * Altruistically ambitious: works or would like to work on projects that make the world better. No astrology or healing stones stuff :-)
   * Intellectually excitable: enjoys learning, exploring with their mind, and growing together
   * Emotionally in tune and mature, secure attachment style, high reliability
   * Overall healthy lifestyle: does not need to be a vegan yogi, just someone who takes care of themselves and their future self to age in a healthy way
   * Playful and humorous
Plus points:
   * Would be okay to live in one or multiple moderately-sized cities (300k-1M) close to larger bodies of water, and somewhere not too cold in the winter
   * Has a creative outlet one can engage in together, e.g., plays at least one instrument well, and maybe would like to jam together
   * Might be interested in working on projects, initiatives, or organizations together one day
In case youâ€™re uncertain how to approach me, here are some icebreaker questions you could answer:
   * What is your current mission, and what would you rise from the ashes for?
   * What was a bold decision that you made recently?
   * What is one thing you changed your mind about recently, and the reason why you did?


  



  

No, no, pinky promise, this is really me! ;-)

About Me
Thoughtful, intellectually curious, and ethically driven, I value deep connections, emotional stability, and personal growth. I enjoy philosophy, science, nature, and mindful physical activity, living simply while prioritizing honesty and meaningful relationships.
Detailed Description
I  speak English and French fluently and Iâ€™m currently in Europe, but I have recently lived in the US (for 4 years) and India (for 6 months). I'm mostly looking for
Collaborations: working together on a joint project that we enjoy. I started Compass, and I'm actively looking for ambassadors to volunteer together and share the platform with their network! We could have meetings and discuss how to reach the people who would benefit from it the most. Regardless, hit me up if you have anything to say about Compass! I'm also happy to work on any other project we find meaningful.
Friendships: mostly to discuss online and share deeper things (see details below).
Life partnership: with a woman who deeply resonates with what I wrote below.
Core Values
Highly stable and non-negotiable guiding principles that shape my worldview, decisions, and moral framework.
Intellectual curiosity with rational integrity: I evaluate beliefs against evidence and enjoy conversations that challenge and expand my thinking.
Ethical responsibility / Utilitarian-leaning ethics: I consciously act to reduce suffering and improve outcomes on a large scaleâ€”through causes like animal welfare, climate change, AI safety, and global poverty.
Emotional stability and resilience: I remain calm under stress, self-soothe effectively, and approach conflicts with reason rather than panic or overreaction.
Deep, loving relationships: I thrive in profound 1-on-1 connections where accountability, honesty, and mutual growth are prioritized.
Growth-oriented conflict resolution: I engage in solution-focused dialogue, tolerate relational discomfort, and prioritize repair over avoidance.
Integrity & deliberateness: I aim to live according to my principles and consciously cultivate trust, depth, and clarity during relationships.
Tolerance for differences: Iâ€™m very willing to connect with people who fit more than 70% of these values, embracing trade-offs and growth together.
Lifestyle & Secondary Values
Traits or principles that matter to me, but are negotiable or context-dependent. Mostly applying to life partnershipsâ€”not friendships.
Life Vision & Practicalities:
Geography: I enjoy living in Europe but am open to relocate if circumstances align.
Family: Iâ€™d like 1â€“2 children within roughly 5â€“10 years, depending on mutual readiness.
Career / lifestyle: I support a partnerâ€™s work and ambitions, as long as we can spend meaningful time together (2+ hours most days).
Financial approach: I live frugally, saving or donating the rest, but am comfortable if my partner spends more on things meaningful to her.
Attachment & Intimacy Needs
Conflict & repair: I notice when someone is hurt, but I do not chase them if they withdraw. I prefer calm, constructive conversations when both sides are ready. Because I'll care about you, I'll express it when I think you may be wrongâ€”at the same time, I'll always have your back.
Emotional intelligence: Iâ€™m aware of my emotions and take time to process before responding, which helps me stay calm in tense moments. I try to express my feelings honestly, listen carefully to understand others, and take responsibility when I misstep. I believe that, with mutual effort, we can keep strengthening our emotional intelligence and connection as a healthy, securely attached couple.
Emotional expressiveness: More through words, modest body language and thoughtful gifts than grand gestures.
Preferred intimacy style: I enjoy direct and meaningful connectionsâ€”long dedicated conversations over frequent, shallow texts. I seek a monogamous relationship.
Lifestyle Habits & Daily Rhythms:
Dietary choices: Mostly vegan; I strongly value sensitivity to animal well-being.
Sleep & energy patterns: Typically 11pmâ€“8am; similar routines are a plus.
Exercise & health: Small-group activities several times per week. Open to mental health practices to improve relationships and wellbeing.
Social engagement: Few close friendships; comfortable connecting with more socially active or community-involved partners.
Family engagement: Average.
Minimalism: I live a simple and non-performative life without clutter, in order to focus on what truly matters.
Emotional & Cognitive Style:
Humor: Mix of wit, playful absurdity, and sarcasm.
Tolerance for uncertainty: Comfortable with ambiguity, but appreciate clear plans when possible.
Romantic philosophy: Love grows deliberately; romance and thoughtful gestures (e.g., poems) are enjoyable once fundamental compatibilities are aligned.
Role expectations: Prefer equal partnership, but open to specialization if mutually desired.
Interests & Activities
Activities or pursuits I enjoy but that donâ€™t define my ethics or essential lifestyle.
Intellectual pursuits: Reading nonfiction, exploring philosophy, science, history, and practical wisdom; hands-on learning through building and fixing things.
Deep conversation: Intense, thoughtful dialogue with like-minded people.
Optimization & personal growth: Exploring methods to improve life, productivity, and learning practices.
Nature & mindfulness: Contemplative walks or time in natural landscapes; pausing to observe wildlife or scenery inspires awe.
Physical activities: Running, biking, swimming, weightliftingâ€”often integrated with mindfulness.
Influences
Contents that majorly influenced my worldview.
Books:
Thinking, Fast and Slow - Daniel Kahneman
The Art of Living a Meaningless Existence - Robert Pantano
Le Petit Prince - Antoine de Saint-ExupÃ©ry
Lâ€™Ã©tranger - Albert Camus
Existential Physics - Sabine Hossenfelder
The Big Picture - Sean Carroll
Doing Good Better - William MacAskill
Emotional Intelligence - Daniel Goleman
Waking Up - Sam Harris
Deep Work - Cal Newport
Sapiens - Yuval Noah Harari
Being the Change - Peter Kalmus
YouTube channels:
The Pursuit of Wonder
Kurzgesagt
Feel free to send recommendations or discuss any content you like!
About You
To an imperfect extent, I like who I am and what I do, and would like to see it in the people around me. So, Iâ€™m mostly looking for people who identifyâ€”at least partiallyâ€”with the description above and would enjoy the same activities. I believe in growth and potential; so I embrace people who are not there yet (so am I) but have, deep inside, the intention to reach it.
As long as you fit some of the description, relationships, to me, transcend gender, age, culture, financial situation, or any other socio-demographic factors; please reach out to me regardless of your situation if you relate to my personality traits. Locations should not be an issue either (a priori); Iâ€™ve had close long-distance friendships which worked beautifully for me.
About Us
I would love to form a close friendship with 3-5 people, and one life partnership with a woman. If you want a shallower connection, thatâ€™s also okay; maybe we can still contribute to each otherâ€™s lives.
I'm also looking for collaboration, whether on Compass or any other project which I would be aligned with.
While some key relationship values, such as depth and trust, grow over time, there is one value which, I believe, should be there from the start: honesty. In this regard, please be honest about your intentionsâ€”which may include different types of relationships depending on how it evolves, and thatâ€™s okay.
Things I'm currently exploring and I'd like to discuss with whoever is interested:
Population ethics in utilitarianism (total view vs neutral / person affective, longtermism, What we owe the future from MacAskill)
Moral realism vs anti-realism, the different sub types of anti-realism, mostly constructivism and non-cognitivism (Bertrand Russell, Sean Carroll)
Consciousness, and whether the hard problem is really a problem
Do multidisciplinary research / PhD across science and philosophy
If emotional intelligence, unlike IQ, is context-dependent (one can have high EI with one type of person, and low EI with another), how important is it to have high EI across all contexts? What proportion of EI is objective (high across all contexts)?
Effective altruism
Disclaimers
This document desperately lacks elaboration, emotions, and personal information for privacy reasons. I have no issue sharing about my life story, what I look like, what I feel and think, vulnerability, intimacy, and other personal features in private.
Endorsements
If you know them, write something nice that adds to their profile.

ALT
Iâ€™m looking for a long-term relationship with a woman who
Shares my values, especially with respect to valuing honesty, truth-seeking, and compassion for others
Shares my interests, especially interest in self-improvement and in learning about ideas in philosophy, economics, math, computer science, and/or science in general from a somewhat skeptical/pragmatic perspective. Other shared interests in general nerd stuff would also be great

Less-basic info
Exercise

Hobbies

In addition to writing a blog, I also read a lot of blogs. I am currently subscribed to over 500 blogs on substack (only one paid though) and a few dozen more through RSS feeds. Adam's date-me doc
Who am I?
Adam: Male, Straight, 6'2", Monogamous, Wants Kids, Boston (but open to lots of travel initially), born 1993.
adamjermyn@gmail.com
I feel motivated by family, by curiosity, and by doing what I think is right:
I chose to live in Boston to be close to family, even though this introduced significant challenges to my career.
I studied Physics and Astronomy because I find awe and wonder in the natural world, and especially the stars, and have a deep curiosity about how it all works.
Three years ago I left Astronomy to work on AI Safety after almost a decade of study and work because I think AI is going to change the world, and it's important to make sure that change is positive. I'm now a research lead on Anthropic's
Interpretability team
.
Pros of dating me
I
produce
a lot of creative artifacts. From journal articles to blog posts to paintings, almost all of my time is spent creating something I can share with others.
I'm really excited to have kids with the right partner, ideally in the next 3-5 years , and I'm genuinely eager to do half of the parenting work. My parents are also amazing with kids, and it's likely they'd be around and able to help (especially if we have kids on the sooner side).
I'm happy and able to comfortably support a family financially, even a large one, on just my income. So while I'm very happy to share financial responsibility, I can also imagine a relationship with someone who wants to spend more time with the kids, or who wants to pursue a career for passion rather than pay.
I care a lot about doing what I think is right, which includes being scrupulously honest and holding myself to a high standard of integrity.
I genuinely delight in lifting my partner up. I have a strong supportive instinct, so I'd love to provide encouragement, coaching, and help in charting a course towards your hopes and dreams, and I'd love to have your help in turn with mine.
I tend to see things that need to be done far in advance, and can do the research to make it happen even in difficult circumstances. For instance, at the height of the pandemic I wrote analyses of COVID testing
protocols
and transmission mechanics that correctly predicted subsequent expert consensus several months in advance.
I host a lot of recurring events for friends (boardgame nights, "quiet reading & tea" nights, bagel brunches on the weekends). I find hosting energizing and get a lot out of providing a "third space"
for community
. A lot of my choices have been motivated by wanting to make this possible.
I'm very agentic when it comes to my health and that of those around me (to the extent this is welcome). I've written
literature reviews
on medical questions for friends / partners who wanted help navigating unusual questions where it's otherwise hard to get actionable advice.
Cons
I'm pretty self-reflective, which can sometimes tip into overthinking things I've said or done, or am planning to do. This comes up most in professional settings but you'll likely see it occasionally in a relationship too. I've made some progress on this but it's still something I'm actively working on.
I spend a lot of time "living in the future" (e.g. anticipating what might happen, both positive and negative, related to above), and sometimes need help grounding in the moment. This is also something I have experience doing for friends / partners so I'm very happy to reciprocate if you need the same.
I find conflict somewhat aversive, and have to push myself to engage in important disagreements outside of technical topics. I know conflict is important, and I can get myself to engage in difficult conversations when necessary, but I've historically been slow to do so. In the last year or so I've made a lot of progress on this, and I expect to keep getting better at it in the near future.
As a contrast to the last point, I really care about the truth, and am likely to push back on things I don't think are true in conversation, which can come across as disagreeable. Of course this same tendency can be a plus, since it means I try my best to be honest and act with integrity, and I work hard to update my views in the face of evidence.
I get migraines. Untreated, these were very bad. With medication they're well-controlled, but I still try to avoid triggers like very loud environments and sleep deprivation. When I'm sick (e.g. with a cold) the medication is much less effective, and I'm reasonably likely to be totally out-of-commission 2-3 days out of a week-long illness. There are also occasionally times when I need to duck out of plans and find a dark/quiet place.
Vibes
We're more likely to be compatible if:
You're excited about the natural world
and want to spend time in it. Think walks on beaches, easy-to-moderate hikes, botanical gardens, national parks, and the night sky. Hiking especially is something I do a lot, and being able to share that would mean a lot to me.
You're excited about some technical subject
(science, math, economics, etc.). I really love talking with people who can teach me new things, or who can share in the joy of discovery together, or who're curious about these subjects. I'm truly delighted to spend an evening digging into a thorny question with a thought partner.
You value your own integrity
, and know how to act on that. This might mean being truth-seeking, forming your own moral views, setting boundaries, and advocating for what you want/need.
You bring intentionality to the relationship.
Creating dedicated time and space for connectionâ€”whether that's regular check-ins, rituals we build together, or simply being present with each otherâ€”matters a lot to me.
Some Important Things
I'm monogamous.
I'm looking to have biological kids. I'm flexible about timelines, and want to be sure to build a strong and close relationship first. My guess is that means somewhere in the next 3-5 years, but I could imagine moving faster if that feels right. I'd want us to be proactive about fertility considerations (like egg freezing if needed) so we have options. Being on the same page about this is really important.
I'm politically moderate / a "classical liberal". If you're looking for someone who's far left or far right, that's not me (and I have many views that don't fall neatly on the left-right spectrum).
I'm open to starting a relationship long-distance with regular visits. If things are going well though I'd like to find a way to co-locate / be in the same city. I'm pretty firmly rooted in Boston, so while it's not impossible that I could move, it's also not very likely.
My work is based in SF and I have to periodically travel there (currently 1 week / 2 months, though the cadence is somewhat flexible). If you wanted to join me on some of those trips that would be very exciting.
What I do in my free time
Reading
Boardgames (Spirit Island is my favorite, more generally I really like cooperative games)
Videogames (mostly Halo, some Factorio)
Walks / Hikes
Travel (especially to the American West)
Exercise (I got really into strength training during the pandemic and have kept that up)
Hosting
Singing / voice lessons
Literature reviews / trying to figure out something that confuses me about the world
Things I'm not into
I don't smoke or use any illegal drugs. I also drink very little (it makes me sleep poorly). I don't mind if you drink in moderation. Smoking (including non-tobacco products) is a dealbreaker for me.
I don't mind cats, but wouldn't want to have one. There's a lot of risk of parasites with a cat in the home that I'm just not keen on.
Some Random Facts About Me
I put a lot of thought into designing my spaces to be functional but also warm, and I find it pretty easy to keep them neat/organized. My current home has a lot of hard wood, big windows, bookshelves, seating space, rugs, and indoor trees.
I enjoy Marmite and chutneys (separately).
I've hosted a (mostly) weekly boardgame night for over two years.
I once walked 17 miles from Cambridge, England to the city of Ely. Along the way a cow chased me away because I got too close to her calf.
I'm mostly not excited about dogs, but would be very excited to have a Golden Doodle specifically. They're just so... friendly and grounding and fun. The further a dog gets from "Golden Doodle" energy the less excited I am.
Many of the fossils in my fossil collection are ones I found in the ground in England (oh and also, I have a fossil collection!).
What am I looking for?
I'm looking for a long-term romantic partner to build a life and raise a family with.
Building a life together means being a teamâ€”spending substantial time together, sharing our inner worlds, making sense of the world as thought partners, and navigating challenges side-by-side.
In practice, this might look like:
Weekend mornings with coffee and long conversations, maybe followed by time at the gym or going on a hike together.
Dedicating time regularly to ask "how are you?" and really hold space for the answer, whether it's joyous, difficult, or somewhere in between.
Evening conversations where we process our days and think through the implications of our work together.
Supporting each other's growth and fulfillmentâ€”not just cheerleading, but actively helping chart a course toward what matters and coaching each other through challenges.
Hosting brunch for friends on Sunday, building community together.
A balance of intentional together time and comfortable quiet downtime.
Kids
Iâ€™m really excited about having kids. My ideal is probably 3-4, though the common advice of â€œsee how you feel after each oneâ€ makes a lot of sense to meâ€”itâ€™s genuinely hard to predict how life will go! What matters is that Iâ€™m starting from a place of wanting a larger family, and Iâ€™d hope thatâ€™s something youâ€™re keen on too.
Parenting
For me a huge part of the point of having kids is being actively involved and present in their lives, so I'd expect to spend a lot of my time/energy parenting (potentially including home schooling, if we decided that made the most sense), and want a partner who's motivated by the same. I'm genuinely eager to do half of the parenting work.
Communication
I have a pretty direct communication style in partnership. I usually know what I want and ask for it straightforwardly. If you know what you want and ask for it I'll be very receptive to that!
I also have a pretty good memory, supplemented by a spaced repetition system, so if you tell me a preference/want/need you have there's an excellent chance I'll remember it from that point on.
On the flip side, early on in knowing someone I'm not especially good at picking up on some more subtle forms of communication, but as I get to know someone (especially a partner) I get better at picking up on what's going on with them, and in the long run can be pretty good at this.
Physical Intimacy
Physical intimacy is a really important part of what I'm looking for, both at first and in the long run. If it's not important to you or doesn't sound like what you want long-term, we're probably not a good match!
I know these things don't just magically work, and that connection is something you build with time and care and trust. I'm very here for that. What matters is that we're both people who actively desire and prioritize physical connection as an ongoing part of our relationship, so that we can prioritize finding ways to connect physically and treat that as being as central as e.g. emotional connection.
Beyond that I'll be excited to hear about your preferences and find things we're both keen on. Communication is important to me, and I really appreciate when my partners ask for what they want. I'm also pretty open to exploring here, and won't be put off by you asking for something new!
Intellectual Connection
Intellectual partnership is really important to me. It's part of how I feel seen and secureâ€”knowing we have a shared way of making sense of the world. I love conversations that go deep, whether we're teaching each other from our different domains or figuring something out together. You don't need to work in AI or physics, but you do need to be someone who finds joy in engaging with complex ideas and being a thought partner.
Coordination
I come from a family of planners, so I tend to spot things that need doing quite a ways off and plan accordingly. I also tend to get anxious when it feels like my partner and I aren't on the same page about where we're going / what we're aiming for long-term (even if we don't stick to those plans / even as life twists and turns).
You don't need to be a natural planner yourself, but it's important that you're willing to engage in those conversations with me - to think together about our direction and make plans as a team. If the thought of having regular check-ins about where we're headed (long-term and short-term) doesn't appeal to you, we're probably not a good match!
Money
I think money is a resource we can use to fulfill our values, including personal consumption but also values like altruism and community. I don't think it's bad to spend money, and I don't think frugality is a virtue (beyond the virtue of living within our means).
On a practical level, I'm fortunate to have a job that means I can comfortably support a family financially on just my income. I'm very happy to share financial responsibility, and at the same time I can imagine a relationship with someone who wants to spend more time with the kids, or who wants to study full-time, or who wants to pursue a career for passion rather than pay.
Family
Family is important to me. I grew up as the youngest of three and have a large extended family of cousins (mostly in New England). I have really fond memories of large gatherings at my grandparentsâ€™ home, and thatâ€™s something Iâ€™d love for my kids to get to experience.
These days we do large family vacations together, as well as smaller gatherings, and spending time with my family is one of the most rewarding things I do. It's important to me for you to join me in this (and my family is really, truly welcoming!), and I'd be excited to join you with your family too.
Religion
I think there's a lot of wisdom in religious traditions, and also there are a lot of restrictions in the details of observance that can run counter to my values, so I tend to err on the side of less observance and more "spirit of the law".
I was raised in a conservative Jewish household, and identify as atheist but culturally Jewish. I'd be happy to make a mostly-secular home together (which could incorporate traditions from other religions), or something in the "reform-to-conservative" Jewish spectrum. So e.g. I love to host and attend Shabbat dinners, I think the high holidays are a great time for family gatherings, and I think there's a lot of beautiful music in the liturgy. At the same time many of the specifics of observance run counter to my values so I steer clear of those (e.g. not travelling on Shabbat makes it hard to see family, not using a phone on Shabbat is dangerous if an emergency arises, etc.). If strict observance is important to you we're probably not a good fit.
My kitchen currently is kosher (non-hechsher dairy) as a practical matter, because that makes it easier to host and contribute to meals
with community
, but Iâ€™m definitely open to changing that if it conflicts with your values.
Also: I believe quite strongly in a material universe, and would find it difficult to have a partner who believes that the world is influenced by the supernatural (e.g. deities, magic, etc.). So much of my worldview is built on materialism and physical reductionism that I would find it hard to live with integrity in close partnership with someone who doesn't share that understanding of the world.
Giving credit where itâ€™s due: I got the idea to write this doc and a lot of inspiration around e.g. what to include from my friend & colleague Chris Olah, who wrote a similar doc for himself several years ago.

ï»¿ðŸŒ‰ Jamie
Basic details. 22, cishet male, allistic, INFJ 5w4.
Looking for. Rationalist friends (or a companion) with utilitarian-ish or sympathetic views.
Philosophy & Me
Three passions, simple but overwhelmingly strong, have governed my life: the longing for love, the search for knowledge, and unbearable pity for the suffering of mankind.
The eloquent Bertrand Russell (who penned the above at 84) was my gateway to philosophy (and for a fun contrast, The Good Place my gateway to ethics). Iâ€™ve always liked learning, but only philosophy has taught, and continues to teach, me to reconsider my epistemic limits and moral blind spots, to resist the norm of prejudging issues and perspectives, and to respect cognitive diversity.
I donâ€™t live and breathe philosophy, but I find myself on a closer wavelength to those on whom it has made a similar impact.
Lifestyle
Traits:
* ðŸ¢ Introverted and more comfortable in cozy places and 1-on-1 chinwags than in large crowds (though I love a jaunt through the city).
* ðŸŒ± Active, not athletic, and health-conscious, 5â€™9â€. I have no experience with drugs or drinking, though not for highly principled reasons.
* ðŸ’ž Eager to banter with and support those whom I care about.
Hobbies:
* ðŸŽ¸ Guitar and singing.
* ðŸ“š Reading, mainly philosophy, short stories, psychology (Jonathan Haidt, Joshua Greene), and politics (in moderation). Currently enjoying a book on AI alignment and writing an overview of theories of consciousness!
* ðŸ› Cooking.
* ðŸŽ® Video games.
* ðŸ’» UX design.
* ðŸ‘ Occasional volunteering.
Ambitions:
* Graduated and have my sights on a philosophy MA next. In the long term, Iâ€™m partial to teaching and/or doing public philosophy as Iâ€™ve done before, supplementing with UX work if needed. Above all I hope to meet a special someone with whom I can devote time to mutual growth and advocating.
Non-negotiables
* ðŸ«¶ Empathy and open-mindedness (i.e., non-dogmatism), especially in communication. I strive always to be nonjudgy and an active listener.
Beliefs
* Value Realism. There are objectively good and bad things. Itâ€™s common to misinterpret this view as necessitating a commitment to a free-floating abstractum, goodness (or The Good) and the like. Not so. Value is a property of things, like squareness and loudness are properties of bread and bellbirds, respectively; affirming these properties doesnâ€™t imply belief in a free-floating squareness or loudness. Acknowledging this point preempts the oft-made â€œargumentâ€ for skepticism that, since we donâ€™t perceive abstracta, itâ€™s dubious how we could â€œseeâ€ the goodness or badness of anything; the proper response here is that while we donâ€™t see moral value itself, we see instances thereof, akin to seeing tori in donuts or finitude in a life.
* Utilitarianism. As for my view of what instances value, I think feelings or experiences do, informally speaking. This is, in effect, hedonism, a nicely parsimonious theory of value that, when conjoined with other plausible tenets, yields classical utilitarianismâ€”I believe the most plausible moral theory. Some views I consider allies: impartialism, suffering-focused ethics, â€œdeontology for people, utilitarianism for animals.â€
* Anti-speciesism. Of the moral blind spots Iâ€™ve been led to reconsider, perhaps none do I regret failing to notice more than the belief that our species is justified in mistreating others if and because ours is more powerful, intelligent, or whatever. This type of sophistry runs through numerous exclusionary ideologiesâ€“male supremacy, racial supremacy, tribalism, Aryanismâ€“and should, I believe, be laid to rest. There are rational, logical grounds for extending moral concern to all experiencing beings (but know I donâ€™t judge anyone for failing to act consistently with their values; nobodyâ€™s perfect, least of all me).
* Politics. My politics square with my ethics (e.g. pro-foreign aid, pro-gender equality); as general descriptors, â€˜democrat,â€™ â€˜liberal,â€™ and â€˜progressiveâ€™ fit me!
* Religion. Iâ€™m an atheistâ€”though I do admit the existence of some intriguing arguments for a creator! But even if I did become more sympathetic to theism, itâ€™s unlikely it would influence my ethics or lifestyle.
* Spirituality v. ineffability. Many hold the intuition that there exists a â€œhigher powerâ€ that is not necessarily God. While I donâ€™t think this is unreasonable, I confess I cannot relate and so remain skeptical (as I likewise am of claims that meditation/drugs/NDEâ€™s can transmit spiritual knowledge). To be clear, I emphatically accept that certain states (e.g. love, grief) are inexplicable and that you can reasonably believe something even if that thing isnâ€™t scientifically verifiable/testable. However I resist the idea that oneâ€™s altered state can â€œshow themâ€ a posteriori spiritual truths (unless â€œspiritualâ€ is used loosely like â€œsublimeâ€). Perhaps this is close-minded of me. Ultimately though, Iâ€™d prefer (more so for a potential companion) that any gaps between our beliefs and formative experiences can be adequately overcome. (If you are spiritual, Iâ€™ll do my best to be understanding, not resistant.) Perhaps this should be our first conversation starter (;
If youâ€™d like to get to know me more (even if only to gain a chat/debate pal), reach out via the Contact Form, please and tysm ðŸ˜‡

Date Me Doc
yes, that is me giving a talk on a boat
For matchmaker friends and interested strangers. (
what is a date me doc?
)
George Wang
31 / male / 6'1"
Location:
SF (flexible)
Relationship type:
Straight, monogamous
Kids:
Maybe? Ask me about it
My pronouns are he/him but they could be all/yours :)
My love language is sending people more blog posts / essays than anyone can reasonably be expected to read
About me
One of my more load-bearing beliefs is that the world is fundamentally malleable to our actions. That the world can be a better place, that we have the power to improve it, and that
we should
try
.
The main way I currently relate to this is through technological progress. I think AI is going to make the next decade
really weird
, and not all in good ways. As soon as I was convinced this was true, I dropped what I was doing to
focus on making this societal transition safer
. This was a difficult decision with various sacrifices, the most legible of which was a ~75% pay cut (I'm lucky to have financial stability from some earlier successes), but I think this was the right thing to do and I'm glad I did.
Another of my defining values is growth: I see myself as a constant work in progress. This means many things to me â€” being a better friend, a better partner, a better citizen. It means being a sharper scientist as much as it means healing old emotional wounds, and it means developing better habits as much as it means figuring out how to relate to my existential angst.
The way I move through and understand the world is fairly
Bay Area rationalist
coded, which sometimes makes me seem like a system-2-robot kind of person, but I think I have at least as much system-1-hopeless-idealist in me.
(more recently on a "postrat" arc, though I kinda think the distinction is wrong? anyways, mostly this looks like getting much more interested in buddhism)
I take commitments seriously, which might come off as "reliable" to some people and "annoyingly conscientious" to others.
The world is full of side quests and I regularly get nerd-sniped by them. I've built an automated arbitrage bot for
MtG:O
(and eventually got banned ðŸ˜¬), dabbled in sports betting, made a couple of
small games
, and occasionally drop everything I'm doing to chase down alpha in financial markets.
I'm a bit of a dork and love games. One of my favorite framing of games is as
art working in the medium of agency
. I see games as a place to be playful, to be creative, to laugh, to cry, to feel both joy and fear, to compete, and to face challenges and overcome them.
If you like my writing, you'll probably like talking to me. A few that I like that aren't too domain specific:
My PhD cost me $1.17M (but I'd do it again)
,
Sharing is caring
,
Navigating burnout
About you
These are things I'm fairly sure I want:
You have strong values. We don't have to share all of them, but there are things that matter to you that you'd defend (they don't have to be grand, world-shattering things).
You're proactive about shaping your life. When you run into problems or see opportunities, you jump in.
You're kind and empathetic towards others. You try even when it's hard, including those you might not personally like or agree with.
You're deeply curious about the world. You care about what's true and want to learn together.
You're playful! Fun is a terminal value :)
(To be clear, I'm not perfect at all of these myself!)
About... us? ðŸ‘‰ðŸ‘ˆ
Early dates might be activities where it's easy to talk at the same time: hikes, bouldering, board games, cooking dinner together, etc. A lot of early bonding happens through talking and texting for me.
After we're a bit more comfortable, we might hang out more frequently, stay the night regularly, and text throughout the day about
increasingly mundane things
(live-tweeting your life to someone is a real love language, fight me). I also enjoy just being in the same room, so if you also work remotely, we might cowork together often.
Long-term, I'd like to live together and build our relationship into a source of mutual growth. It sounds super cliche but I mean it sincerely â€“ I'd love to have a partnership where we keep inspiring each other to be better. I also travel a decent amount for work reasons (mostly conferences), but usually in great places to visit (last year was unusually travel-heavy, but I visited Mexico City, London, Amsterdam, Melbourne, and the Bay Area). It's always nice to tack some extra time on either end, and a travel partner would be even better!
I have an okay amount of social energy but am more introvert than extrovert and have decided that I mostly don't enjoy activities that involve lots of noise and not much personal space (concerts, clubs, etc). There are some exceptions, but in general I wouldn't expect this to be the kind of thing we regularly do together.
I do like trips outdoors and would love to camp / hike / climb together!
we could
both
be laying here, dying of heat exhaustion
together
Possible dealbreakers?
I don't politically identify as far left or far right. Socially, I tend to be more progressive, but otherwise I have somewhat scattered political positions.
I'm not religious. I respect those who have deeply held religious beliefs, but this  probably means we understand the world in very fundamentally different ways.
I lean towards lower thresholds for sensitivity to disgust. The kinds of compromises I try to aim for seemed to generally be fine in past relationships (and at least one partner was more germophobic than me), but if you have particularly high thresholds for disgust, this might generate friction.
What next?
This is a fairly curated window into who I am, and reality is always more complicated. I don't know what the right discount factor is, but you should apply at least a little.
If you still feel interested, then reach out! Yes, you reading this doc. If you're not sure, please err on the side of getting in contact, that's what this thing is for! The downside might be a small time cost, and the upside is hugely positive for both of us. Don't leave that +EV on the table.
Email me
, message me on
Twitter
, or ask a mutual friend to introduce us. No need for it to be a big deal either, just say hi and we can go from there!
